description: From Old French entrecommuner. See inter- and common.

verbs.description: intercommon (third-person singular simple present intercommons, present participle intercommoning, simple past and past participle intercommoned)

entries.meaning: (obsolete) To share with others; to participate; especially, to eat at the same table.
(obsolete, UK, law) To graze cattle promiscuously in the commons of each other, as the inhabitants of adjoining townships, manors, etc.
